sub_title: General Manager at Dutch Payments Association
summary:
Payments are my passion. Have been all my working life.Relevant, passionate, connecting. I am a professional with extensive (30+ years) knowledge of and experience in payment systems in an international multi lingual, multi stakeholder (Brussels) environment, especially on the cutting edge of payments, technology, public relations, lobby and communications. Capable of operating in complex environments with lots of conflicting interests, especially in a international and multilingual environment. Understanding and building bridges is what it is all about. "Nobody beats the Wizz".

Payments are so much relevant fun ... getting beter every day!

Specialties: Stakeholder management. Strategy. Governance issues. Legal stuff. Competition law. sering opportunities. Connecting the dots.

He has extensive experience in domestic as well as international payments related issues. Closely involved in PSD2/3 matters, open banking and the RTS of the EBA, instant payments and digital euro. He is Chair of the Legal Support Group of the European Payments Council (EPC) after serving several terms as Board member, and Vice-Chair of the Payment Expert Group of the European Banking Federation (EBF, after having served 3 terms as Chair). He is Vice-Chair of the European Card Payments Association (ECPA). Last, he is a member of the Payment Systems Market Expert Group (PSMEG) of the European Commission and co-Chair of the EPC’s SEPA Payment Account Access scheme Multi Stakeholder Group on behalf of the credit sector associations. As of 1 February 2014 my former employer, the Dutch Banking Association, has transferred its remaning tasks in the area of payments to the Payments Association.
